headline.main: Asking $1 Billion, Hartford Sues 7 Tobacco Companies

docs.lead_paragraph: The State Attorney General, Richard Blumenthal, sued seven tobacco companies for $1 billion today, charging that they had engaged in "a conspiracy to mislead, deceive and confuse" Connecticut and its residents about the debilitating and addictive effects of cigarettes. The suit, which was filed in State Superior Court in Stamford, seeks to recover $750 million in Medicaid costs for treatment of tobacco-related illnesses, as well as all past and future profits made in Connecticut. It is believed to be the largest civil action ever brought by the state.
